bibl.title: Chin Quock Wah vs. Henry M. White. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.

In the Matter of the Application of CHIN QUOCK WAH, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. ) No. Further Amended Petition of CHIN QUOCK WAH, by and through ADAM BEELER, of the Law Firm of Beeler & Sullivan, his Attorney.

Comes now Adam Beeler, of the firm of Beeler & Sullivan, as attorney for and in behalf of Chin Quock Wah, an alien, a subject of the Emperor of China, and a son of CHIN WE HUE, a Merchant of the City of Boston, State of Massachutes, and respectfully makes this application for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and alleges as follows:

I. That said Chin Quock Wah is imprisoned and restrained of his liberty, by the United States Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, or by some person or persons acting through, by or under him, and that said Chin Quock Wah, is imprisoned at the Detention House at the Immigration Station in the City of Seattle, King County, State of Washington, and within the jurisdiction of the above entitled Court, under teh charge that the said Chin Quock Wah, was found, and still is, unlawfully in the United States, and that he should be deported according to law, and your petitioner further informs the Honorable Court that said imprisonment, confinement andrestraint and Order of Deportation is illegal and arises from the following facts, to-wit: That the said Ching Quock Wah, was tried in the City of Boston, State of Massachutes, and in the United S tates, and found not entitled to remain in the United States, and that thereafter the said Chin Quock Wah gave notice of appeal and an appeal was taken from the Commissioner before whom he was tried, in the City of Boston, State of Massachutes, to the -1-
Secretary of Labor, and the said Order of Deportation, and the said finding of the Commissioner of Immigration at said City of Boston, State of Massachusetts, was affirmed, and the said Chin Quock Wah, ordered deported.

Your petitioner is informed and believes and so states the fact to be that said Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, of Seattle, King County, in charge of the District of Washington, or his agent or agents, official or officials, acting by, under or through him, or for the United States Government, is about to deport and return the said Chin Quock Wah to China, in violation of the treaty relations between the United S tates and China, and in violation of the laws and statutes of the United States relation to teh acts and powers of the Secretary of Labor and the Assistant Secretary of Labor, in that said Chin Quock Wah is being deprived of his liberty without due process of law and without being given a fiar hearing by said Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, or his agents or officials actions by and under or through him, or for the United States Government.

Your petitioner further alleges that the right of appeal from said Finding of Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, or his agents or officials acting by, under or through him, or for the United States Government in and for the District of Washington, by the statutes in such cases made and provided for in relation to the Chinese Exclusion Laws, has been violated and that his full rights have not been accorded to your Petitioner Chin Quock Wah in this: that W. B. Wilson is the Secretary of and that Louis Post is his only Assistant Secretary of Labor; Labor ; that both of said officials, as your petitioner alleges upon information and belief, and believes the fact to be, were at their respective offices in the capitol at Washington, doing the duties imposed upon them on the day that the said appeal of Chin Quock Wah was considered, and that upon said day and at said time that the appeal of the said Chin Quock Wah, to the -2-
Secretary of Labor, from the decision denying the right to remain in the United S tates of Chin Quock Wah, came up for hearing and consideration, that said Secretary of Labor and the Assistant Secretary of Labor were then and there present in their respective offices, and that the said Secretary of Labor or Assistant Secretary of Labor, under the statutes, should have considered and determined the said appeal of Chin Quock Qah from the said adverse decision of the said Commissioner of Immigration, but that said Secretary of Labor and Assistant Secretary of Labor failed, neglected or refused so todo, and hence the said Chin Quock Wah has been denied his right of appeal, according to law.

Your Petitioner further alleges that one J. B. Densmore is the Solicitor of the Department of Labor, and further alleges that said J. B. Densmore attempted to perform the duties of the Secretary of Labor or Assistant Secretary of Labor while they were present in their respective offices, and the order of the President of the United States, with due respect thereto, does not authorize said J. B. Denmore, or such Solicitor of the Department of Labor to perform the duties of the Secretary of Labor or the Assistant Secretary of Labor, save and except in their absence, and therefore the action of said J. B. Denmore in claiming to be the acting Secretary of Labor during the presence of said officials then and there, is a usurption of the duties imposed upon the said Secretary of the Department of Labor and the said Assistant Secretary of Labor, by Congress, and the said J. B. Densmore, in assuming the duties of the said Secretary of Labor and the Assistant Secretary of Labor and affirming the Finding of the Commissioner of Immigration at Boston Massachusetts, in relation to the ease of Chin Quock Wah, exceeded the statute, and his action in sustaining the adverse decision in relation to the right to remain of Chin Quock Wah in the United States, is null and the said Chin Quock Wah has been denied the right of appeal as provided by the -3-
statutes in such cases.

Your Petitioner on information and belief, further states that the said Chin Quock Qah, has not had a fair and impartial trial before the said Commissioner of Immigration at Boston, Massachusetts; that there is no evidence in the records to sustain the Department's Exclusion and Deporation had illegally ordered his exclusion from entry to the United States and his deportation therefrom without any authority or law, to-wit, by the illegal act of said Solicitor J. B. Densmore, who had no authority to order said deportation, was denied a fair and impartial trial in accordance with law, and that said Chin Quock Wah was denied the right of having his counsel, appear before the Commissioner of Immigration, or the lawful acting Secretary of Labor after said Chin Quok Wah, had appealed from the said illegal act of said Solicitor J. B. Densmore and after said appeal had reached the Department of Labor, in order that said counsel might present the case to the said Commissioner General of Immigration, or the lawfully acting Secretary of Labor, and bring to the attention of said officials the said illegal act of said Solicitor J. B. Densmore, and place certain evidence before said officials which would warrant a reversal of said order of exclusion and deportation, or would warrant their consideration of the appeal of the said Ching Quock Wah.

WHEREFORE, your Petitioner prays that this Court find that the said Ching Quock Qah has not been accorded to the rights and privileges allowed by the Constitution of the United States, and by the treaty between the United States and China, and that he be discharged and allowed to join his father who is a merchant in Boston, Massachusetts.
div1.ab: Beeler, Sullivan Attorney for Chin Quock Wah.
div1.p: STATE OF WASHINGTON, COUNTY OF KING. ) SS

ADAM BEELER, being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says: that he is one of the Attorneys for the said Chin Quock Wah; that he has read the foregoing Further Amended P etition, knows the contents thereof, and that the same is true of his own knowledge; that those facts which he does not know of his own knowledge, he alleges upon information and belief to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 3rd day of March, 1915.
div1.ab: James H Doyle Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
div1.p: IN THE SUPERIOR UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT STATE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON KING COUNTY NORTHERN DIVISION
UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT OF AMERICA Plaintiff VS. CHIN QUOCK WAH. Defendant
BEELER & SULLIVAN Attorneys for Defendant 510-11 WHITE BUILDING SEATTLE, WASH.
2x FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION MAR 4 1915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk By EML Deputy
